channel.title: A little help plz
channel.description: Some one has been hacking my server/ site. I run runescape private server. I think they are getting the password of other account off my site. How can i make it so people can't steel other people passwords. Do you think is a leak or some1 is spying? Should i encrypt the passwords? Will that do it? I know how to encrypt by this tut http://www.onlamp.com/pub/a/php/2001/07/26/encrypt.html . If anyone is a hacker and can help me out with this ill give you more details.

item.title: A little help plz
item.dc:creator: @frugoo_scape frugoo scape
item.description:
@frugoo_scape wrote:

I own the server. I am going to try to put Apache SSL on the server. I am also going to try the crypt(). I banned this person from 3 ip address now. I hope this works.
Keep posting suggestions.

Edit:
I don’t use mysql though. I only use php and txt files. I just have no idea how they could be hacking into the server…

Read full topic

item.title: A little help plz
item.dc:creator: @kloplop321 kloplop321
item.description:
@kloplop321 wrote:

unless they have a cracker that does a hard (can’t remember the word, like killing) attack on the hashes to figure out the pass but that would take a very long time. but you must have some pretty lame security if they can get in your database

Read full topic

item.title: A little help plz
item.dc:creator: @Night26 Night26
item.description:
@Night26 wrote:

its been mentioned before, try to md5 hash your pass’s or better yet use one way encryption like crypt().

Because theres no decrypt command, you can compare encryptions together if they work, and just store the encryptions in the database.
So if a hacker does get the password from the db, he would only be getting encrypted strings, which doesn’t help at all.

http://w3schools.com/php/func_string_crypt.asp

Read full topic

item.title: A little help plz
item.dc:creator: @kloplop321 kloplop321
item.description:
@kloplop321 wrote:

kloplop321:

well what you need(I think from your description) is an anti-MySQL injection and you need to MD5 the passwords anyway(for security reasons.

true, but that up there ^^ is a sure way to have good security no matter what, so they wont have a purpose anyway.

Read full topic
